text: Keng Hau is one of the 41 constituencies in the Sha Tin District in Hong Kong. The constituency returns one district councillor to the Sha Tin District Council, with an election every four years. Keng Hau constituency is loosely based on part of the public estates Hin Yiu Estate and Hin Keng Estate, villages Ha Keng Kau, Sheung Keng Hau, and private flats Pare Royale and Julimount Garden, with an estimated population of 19,588. ==Councillors represented== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- |style="background-color: " | | 1994 | Wai Kwok-hung | Civil Force |- |style="background-color: " | | 2011 | rowspan=2| Daniel Ng Kam-hung | Democratic |- |style="background-color: " | | 2018 | Community Sha Tin |} ==Election results== ===2010s=== ===2000s=== ===1990s=== ==References== Category:Sha Tin Category:Tai Wai Category:Constituencies of Hong Kong Category:Constituencies of Sha Tin District Council Category:1994 establishments in Hong Kong Category:Constituencies established in 1994
title: Keng Hau (constituency)
